channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023070155
item.description:
Report X-2023070155

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the aerosol cans has a puncture hole along the top seam allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Can was empty

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped and vent valve cap became loose and contents leaked out. Package was then put in plastic hazmat bin to prevent further release. DescribePack: the vent valve cap was loose and some of the contents leaked out through the valve. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was then put in plastic hazmat bin to prevent further release.

item.title: Report E-2023070183
item.description:
Report E-2023070183

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 20, 2023, one (1) 6-gallon pail of Rhino Brite was damaged and released one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the damaged pail and contained it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. ES neautrailzed the free standing product and deployed absorbents. All impacted absorbents were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

Report E-2023070169

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 5 gallon cans of X-cide (un2922) releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070150
item.description:
Report E-2023070150

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 16, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of disinfectant was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retianed Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. he drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum for disposal. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All UN1903 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums for disposal. The drums were properly labeled, and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023061661
item.description:
Report X-2023061661

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents the two containers had loose caps causing spillage. Due to the spillage the both containers were soiled. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage.
